column1: 22:26|ten twenty-six p.m.|Siddons shuffled through some papers before he found the document he was looking for. He looked up at the judge and said
column4: that the death certificate was signed at ten twenty-six p.m. on Thursday the twenty-sixth of July

column2: consciousness returned to me progressively from the edges of my field of vision. The first things to claim recognition were the bathroom door emerging from the far right and a lamp from the far left
column3: from which my awareness gradually drifted inward like ice flowing together toward the middle of a lake. In the exact center of my visual field was the alarm clock
column4: hands pointing to ten-twenty-six.|Hard-Boiled Wonderland and the End of the World|Haruki Murakami
